title: Subway station font
content:
Any help ID'ing this greatly appreciated.   
   
 ![subway](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142249im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/24654.jpg)
author: drd

comments.content: It's not a font. [Ultramodern](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142249/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/ultramodern-classic-sg/) is similar as is [Binner](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142249/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/binner/). As far as I know, there isn't a font that looks exactly like or even close to your sample.

I don't know what you need to do with this, but Britannic Bold [http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=403485](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142249/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=403485) with some negative Squooshï¿½(squetch??)applied would give a very similar effect.

See also Benn Coifman's [Illinois Central](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142249/http:/www.railfonts.com/cgi/font-store/fontshop.cgi?ACTION=thispage&thispage=page12.html&ORDER_ID=322348988#) (he makes   
train related fonts). It will get you, I think, closer to the   
hardest letter to match, the S.

Nice find. It's a bit crude, but reasonably close.   
   
I just remembered another one: [Magnesium](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516142249/http:/www.fonthaus.com/products/fonts/view.cfm?CFID=100108&CFTOKEN=34681066&SKU=MB30109). It has the right overall feel, but some of the details (like the poiny A and N) are different.
Thanks, everyone. Very useful insights. The project is a personal one to record mosaic artwork in a local subway system.
